New Records: Yerson Mosquera opened the scoring in the 25th minute, breaking no records
James Rodríguez gave a perfect cross for Mosquera to nod in and opening the scoring, equalizing Carlos Valderrama's record of 11 assists in South American World Cup qualifying
James Rodríguez beat Emiliano Martínez, a prolific penalty stopper, and equalized Falcao García's mark of 13 goals in World Cup qualifying
Key Match Events: Yerson Mosquera opened the scoring in the 25th minute
Nico González capitalized on a defensive blunder from the Colombians to equalize in the 48th
James Rodríguez scored from the penalty spot to seal Colombia's 2-1 win over Argentina in the 60th minute
Pre-Game Insights: There are no pre-game insights mentioned in the article
Post-Match Reflections: Argentina's strikers Lautaro Martínez and Julián Álvarez failed to offer as much danger as they do when veteran Messi is there to create opportunities for them
Colombia, which hadn't beaten Argentina since 2019, is still unbeaten in South American World Cup qualifying
Miscellaneous Highlights: Argentina leads the round-robin competition with 18 points after eight matches, two point clear of Colombia
The top six teams in South American qualifying will get automatic spots at the 2026 World Cup
Injured Argentina star Lionel Messi didn't play in Barranquilla in what was the first match between the teams since the Copa América final
Others: The match was played at the Metropolitano Roberto Meléndez in Barranquilla, Colombia
The match was broadcast on ESPN2 and ESPN+
